poem:
Title: In Pints of Shadowed Sorrow

'Neath the pall of points debated,
Lie the victims, blood abated.
Shadows cast on sterile floor,
A virus' kiss in '70, once more.

Politicians in towering halls,
Speak not the guilt their silence calls.
Gaslit lives, dismissed in shame,
Lessons lost, repeat the game.

Hepatitis C, and HIV's might,
In blood's betrayal, guard the night.
